title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 17 ยง 78.39 - Unauthorized commercial activity, entertainment, and solicitation of alms prohibited
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 17 ยง 78.39 - Unauthorized commercial activity, entertainment, and solicitation of alms prohibited

State Regulations

No person, unless duly authorized by the airport operator, shall, in or upon the airport: (a) sell, or offer for sale, any article of merchandise; or
(b) solicit any business or trade, including
the carrying of baggage for hire, the shining of shoes or bootblacking; or
(c) entertain any persons by
singing, dancing, or playing any musical instrument; or
(d) solicit alms. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 17
ยง
78.39

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
